item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, February 17, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Homemade polarimetric synthetic aperture radar drone (230 points | 20 comments)
2. Word embeddings – Part 3: The secret ingredients of Word2Vec (22 points | 2 comments)
3. Uchū – Color scheme for internet lovers (399 points | 160 comments)
4. How do modern compilers choose which variables to put in registers? (47 points | 2 comments)
5. San Francisco homelessness: Park ranger helps one person at a time (153 points | 201 comments)
6. Anno 1800: Shadows of Beauty (52 points | 3 comments)
7. All Kindles can now be jailbroken (263 points | 93 comments)
8. I pulled data on 1378 restaurants from Google Maps to rank them in order (33 points | 12 comments)
9. Does or did COBOL default to 1875-05-20 for corrupt or missing dates? (101 points | 132 comments)
10. Flea-Scope: $18 Source Available USB Oscilloscope, Logic Analyzer and More [pdf] (282 points | 92 comments)
11. MySQL at Uber (48 points | 12 comments)
12. Opposing arrows of time can theoretically emerge from certain quantum systems (57 points | 58 comments)
13. “A calculator app? Anyone could make that” (1413 points | 350 comments)
14. Show HN: Air traffic control radio and chill music for focus (153 points | 84 comments)
15. IPv6 Is Hard (157 points | 241 comments)
16. Extreme supersonic winds measured on a planet outside our solar system (25 points | 5 comments)
17. Ugandan runner Jacob Kiplimo completes first ever sub-57 minute half marathon (77 points | 22 comments)
18. Javier Milei backtracks on $4.4B memecoin after 'insiders' pocket $87M (146 points | 154 comments)
19. Hans Bethe Stumbled Upon Perfect Quantum Theories (4 points | discuss)
20. Gold Is Worth More in New York (68 points | 65 comments)
21. YouTube asks channel owner to verify phone, permanently overwrites personal info (170 points | 122 comments)
22. Explaining my fast 6502 code generator (2023) (76 points | 16 comments)
23. My Time at MIT (6 points | discuss)
24. Physics Informed Neural Networks (27 points | 1 comment)
25. Half-Life 2 and Dishonored art lead Viktor Antonov has died (442 points | 88 comments)
26. Publish Your Gaussian Splats with SuperSplat (33 points | 3 comments)
27. OpenVINO AI effects [denoising and transcription] for Audacity (121 points | 24 comments)
28. Did the Windows 95 setup team forget that MS-DOS can do graphics? (77 points | 28 comments)
29. United States Power Outage Map (273 points | 133 comments)
30. Comparison of File Systems for an SSD (3 points | 2 comments)
